util.error

Class Exceptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.error.Exceptions

  • public class Exceptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper methods to work with exceptions.

    • Method Detail

      • throwAsIfUnchecked

        public static java.lang.RuntimeException throwAsIfUnchecked(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Masks the given exception as a runtime (unchecked) exception and throws it as such, fooling compiler and JVM runtime. Use with extreme care!
        Parameters:
        t - the exception to recast to RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        nothing as t will be thrown.
        See Also:
        How does it work?, Advantages, disadvantages, and limitations.

      • unchecked

        public static <T> java.util.function.Consumer<T> unchecked(ConsumerE<T> mayThrowChecked)
        Convenience up-cast so that an exception-throwing lambda can be used in place of a normal one.
        Parameters:
        mayThrowChecked - value to up-cast.
        Returns:
        the up-cast input.

      • unchecked

        public static <T> java.util.function.Supplier<T> unchecked(SupplierE<T> mayThrowChecked)
        Convenience up-cast so that an exception-throwing lambda can be used in place of a normal one.
        Parameters:
        mayThrowChecked - value to up-cast.
        Returns:
        the up-cast input.

      • unchecked

        public static <T,R> java.util.function.Function<T,R> unchecked(FunctionE<T,R> mayThrowChecked)
        Convenience up-cast so that an exception-throwing lambda can be used in place of a normal one.
        Parameters:
        mayThrowChecked - value to up-cast.
        Returns:
        the up-cast input.

      • runUnchecked

        public static void runUnchecked(ActionE mayThrowChecked)
        Runs the given action, re-throwing any exception without wrapping.
        Parameters:
        mayThrowChecked - the action to run.
        See Also:
        throwAsIfUnchecked(Throwable)

      • getOrThrow

        public static <T> T getOrThrow(Either<? extends java.lang.Exception,T> errorOrValue)
        Either gets the right value or throws the left exception.
        Parameters:
        errorOrValue - an error or a value.
        Returns:
        the value if the argument is a right; otherwise the given exception will be thrown.
